review: I am not a fan of anything Google...and I know this is entirely different than email, etc. HOWEVER, I think the feeling is mutual because I cannot get this thing to work for the life of me!! My boyfriend has one at work, LOVES it. We HAD to have one. I got one, and since the night before Thanksgiving (almost a month now), it's worked an entire two times. When it works...it's amazing. But it doesn't tend to work. My boyfriend keeps blaming it on our router...maybe he's right. But I'm not convinced.

author: Ray Bellotti

review: I got the chromecast to put some of my son's cartoons on TV at different times.  We also enjoy watching programs from Hulu Plus.  From my iPhone (and with the apps) Chromecast works great.  We hardly notice any quality difference and very little buffering.  Google says you can cast from the Chrome browser on a PC... absolutely not.  My laptop is high quality and our high speed internet is great, but casting from the PC doesn't work at all.  No biggie.  I hope Google adds Vudu and a few others to their service soon.
author: D. J. Klein "jtown11"

review: This device has not yet reach adulthood. Go get the Roku 3 instead. I only bought this thing to stream youtube videos on my TV because at the time Roku didn't have a youtube channel for that. Of course after I buy this crap you can now watch Youtube videos on Roku. Sheesh.First I had problems installing. It wouldn't see my wifi connection from my laptap. And my wifi is not hidden. After trying numerous times I finally googled the problem. Found out others were having the same issue but they were able to install with their android tablet. I opened my nexus 7 and finally got it working. Oddly it worked fine on my laptop after installing from my tablet.So it works and its slow. Streaming chrome explorer or youtube vids works fine but netflix is too slow. Having to use your tablet or laptop is awkward, compared to using a remote.Just get a Roku. I heard the Apple TV is good too, but I have no experience with it. Basically if you buy from Itunes you might prefer the Apple TV - or a Roku if you get your media from Amazon. Hope this helps.
author: C. Davis

review: Doesn't work with my 1 year old Samsung TV, but worked fine on my 2 year old Panasonic. Haven't decided if I'm going to return it yet.
